    • getAllUsers

      @GetMapping("") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Iterable<UserOutputDto>> getAllUsers()
      GET method to get a list of all users from the database
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with OK http status code and a list with all users

    • createUser

      @PostMapping("") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> createUser(@Valid @RequestBody @Valid UserInputDto userInputDto, org.springframework.validation.BindingResult bindingResult)
      POST method to create a new user in the database
      Parameters:
      userInputDto - Data Transfer Objects that carries data between processes in order to reduce the number of methods calls
      bindingResult - a Spring object that holds the result of the validation and binding and contains errors that may have occurred
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with created http status code and URI pointing to the newly created entity, or bindingResultError if there is an error in the binding

    • patchUser

      @PatchMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> patchUser(@PathVariable("id") Long userId, @RequestBody UserPatchDto userPatchDto)
      PATCH method that updates a user only when the user exists in the database
      Parameters:
      userId - ID of the user for which information is requested
      userPatchDto - Data Transfer Objects that carries data between processes in order to reduce the number of methods calls
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with OK http status code and the updated user, or bindingResultError if there is an error in the binding

    • deleteUser

      @DeleteMapping("/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<Object> deleteUser(@PathVariable("id") Long userId)
      DELETE method to delete a user from the database by id
      Parameters:
      userId - ID of the person for which information is requested
      Returns:
      ResponseEntity with no content http status code
